summary: Completed comprehensive testing of HATA Humanitarian website UI/UX updates. All major changes implemented successfully: hero section uses brand blue (#0A2463), about section has gradient with floating vision card, programs section has navy blue with image overlay, team section has modern card design, contact section has red gradient, partners section has slate-50 gradient, and donate page is fully redesigned with stats and donation cards.
passed_tests: Homepage hero section has brand blue (#0A2463) background instead of dark slate
About section displays with gradient background (slate-50 to blue-50)
About section includes floating vision card with red gradient styling
Programs section has navy blue (#0A2463) background with Winnipeg image overlay
Team/Board section displays 3 members with modern card-based design
Team cards have proper hover effects and shadow transitions
Contact section has red (#D80032) gradient background
Contact section displays 4 method cards: Email, Phone, WhatsApp, Visit
Partners section has slate-50 gradient background
Partners section displays 3 partner cards with proper styling
Donate page hero has brand blue background
Donate page shows impact stats: 3 Core Programs, 500+ Lives Impacted, 100% Community-driven, 5+ Years
Donate page displays 3 donation method cards: E-Transfer, By Mail, Contact
All donation cards have proper hover effects with color transitions
All navigation links work correctly (About, Programs, Team, Podcasts, Contact, Partners)
Mobile navigation menu works with responsive design
Back-to-top button appears on scroll and functions correctly on both pages
Desktop and mobile viewports render correctly
All data-testid attributes present for automated testing
External links open properly with correct attributes
Backend API endpoints (8/8) all working: health, featured-activities, contact form validation
Typography properly implemented with Playfair Display and Lato fonts
Brand colors (#0A2463 blue, #D80032 red) consistently used throughout
Glassmorphism and modern UI effects working correctly
All interactive elements (buttons, cards, links) have proper hover states
